abstract: While helping transfer money into an elementary school lunch money system, eBay’s PayPal shows that it is more interested in cutting its costs than helping users, thereby ceding some of its franchise to Google Checkout.
snippet: While helping transfer money into an elementary school lunch money system, eBay’s PayPal shows that it is more interested in cutting its costs than helping users, thereby ceding some of its franchise to Google Checkout.
lead_paragraph: It’s not easy competing with Google. But a few minutes trying to buy my daughters their school lunches showed me why I think eBay’s PayPal will lose ground to Google Checkout.

headline.main: PayPal is Rude in the Lunch Line
